Please help us spread the word!

District Three had a unanimous vote (9-0) to reschedule the referendum for July 14 as requested by Governor McMaster's executive orders.

If this referendum passes, it’ll provide a significant tax cut for District Three residents and businesses. It’ll also allow the District to renovate and upgrade all schools more than a decade faster than having to pay for it a little bit at a time. If the referendum passes, the board would no longer have to access the 8% debt limit annually, therefore, making constituents’ taxes cheaper on a yearly basis and in the long run.

If the Governor removes restrictions and we are able to safely hold small community discussions, we will plan town hall meetings on the days leading up to the election. Until then, we plan to hold virtual meetings and send information via mail to try to spread the word about the new election date and encourage constituents to get out and vote.

We also understand some people might want to avoid the polls during this time and would like to encourage anyone who feels uncomfortable to vote absentee.

Thank you for continuing to support our community!

Let us never forget this Senior group of Centurions and what they mean to the history of our Getty’s D. Broome family.
We love you guys and thank you for always making us so proud! 🙌🏻

#Every Ball field was lit in their honor.

Right now, school taxes for residents are $155 a year per $100,000 home. This referendum, if it passes, would reduce taxes to $47 per $100,000 home.

We're so excited to announce Gettys D. Broome High School has been chosen as a national finalist for the Community Service Project Award through Varsity Brands!

Our nominator said:

"Martin Luther King, Jr. said, “The function of education is to teach one to think intensively and to think critically. Intelligence plus character – that is the goal of true education.”
At no other school in the country can you find the administration, faculty and student body living this mantra more than the folks who call Gettys D. Broome High School their home. This Spartanburg, South Carolina high school embodies the spirit of community service and brotherhood every day, every week, every year."

At District Three, we believe teaching students compassion, philanthropy and kindness are as important as teaching school subjects. We are so proud of our students and this nomination!

https://www.varsitybrands.com/awards/categories
